intro: Elytranthe exocarpi, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentamerous flowers that typically have five petals and five sepals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many plants in the Malvaceae family. The leaves are alternate and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
